meanings.definition: relating to or caused by influenza
meanings.sent1: The doctor explained that the influezal vaccine would help prevent the flu.
meanings.sent2: She had an influezal cough and fever, so she stayed home to rest.
meanings.sent3: The influezal sneezes from the cartoon character made everyone laugh.
meanings.sent4: The influezal spread of rumors in the office was hard to contain.
meanings.sent5: The influezal symptoms of tiredness and body aches were unmistakable.

meanings.sent1: The influezal weather with its sudden changes made people cautious.
meanings.sent2: Her influezal manner of speaking, with a hoarse voice, worried her friends.
meanings.sent3: The influezal color of the painting reminded him of a cold winter day.
meanings.sent4: The influezal melody of the song brought back memories of being sick.
meanings.sent5: The influezal smell of disinfectant filled the hospital corridors.
